result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerzon Sanchez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Gerzon Sanchez in court, in custody with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 13CM623, 14CM226, 14CF230, & 14CF242.  Sentencing recommendations given by State and Defense.  Defendant addressed the court.  In 14CF230 court sentenced defendant to serve 6 months in jail, with Huber for treatment and work release.  135 days jail credit.  Court considers time served in this case.  In 14CF242 Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 month in jail, with Huber for work and treatment, consecutive to his other cases.  66 days jail credit.  In 14CM226 Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 month jail, with Huber for work and treatment, consecutive to other cases.  5 days jail credit.  In 13CM623 Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 months jail, with Huber for work and treatment, consecutive to other cases.  2 days jail credit.  A civil judgment will be entered for all cases for the outstanding balances due.
Appointed Attorney Michael Covey
This matter is set for a revocation hearing upon receipt of papers from DOC.  Defendant should contact the public defender regarding representation prior to hearing date.  Defendant must be present.

Defendant Gerzon Sanchez in court, in custody with attorney Andrew I Martinez.  Jane E Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Cases called:  14CM226, 13CM623, 13CM708, 14CF230, & 14CF242.  Rights/Elements.  In 14CM226 Defendant plead no contest to Ct 2.  14CF242 Defendant plead no contest to Ct. 1.  14CF230 Defendant plead no contest to Ct. 3.  13CM623 Defendant plead no contest to Ct. 1.   Court found guilty.  Judgment entered. In Case 14CM226  Withhold sentencing placed on probation 3 yrs concurrent.   $543.00 costs and domestic violence surcharge.  Cash bond on hand to be applied towards costs.  5 days jail credit.  Dismiss but read in Cts. 1, 3, 4, & 5.   Case 14CF242  Ct. 1 Withhold sentencing placed on probation for 3 yrs, concurrent.  $543.00 costs and domestic violence surcharge. 22 days jail credit.  Cts. 2, 3,4,5,6, & 7 dismissed but read in.  14CF230 Ct. 3  Withhold sentencing placed on probation 3 yrs concurrent.  $443.00 costs.  3 days jail credit.  Cash bond on hand to be applied towards costs.  Dismiss but read in Cts. 1, 2, 4, 5, 6, 7, & 8.  Case 13CM623 Ct. 1 Withhold sentencing placed on probation 3 yrs. concurrent.  $543.00 costs and domestic violence surcharge.  2 days jail credit.  Dismiss but read in Cts. 2, & 3.   In all cases defendant is to complete AODA and comply, complete Domestic Abuse Counseling, Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 6 month review with Br. 3.   Case 13CM708 Dismiss but read in all counts.  No jail credit due.
